result.execSummary:
The defendant Aereol Rose Weaver was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate w/o Valid License(2nd w/in3 Yrs), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.05(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: JOC Returned - Moved - Left No Address - UTA

Case called @ 3:23 p.m. Defendant Aereol Rose Weaver in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: NC. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. No statement by DE. Court orders: 2 days WC Jail - 2 Days CFTS - Time served sentence, costs w/ 60 DTP or PP, DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal rights given.
by USPS - Moved, Left no Address - Unable to Forward
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 13, 2016 at 03:15 pm.
Defendant and Attorney Szilagyi appear by video

Court releases defendant upon previously ordered signature bond.

Case called @ 2:33 p.m. Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant not present in court. Based on non appearance the Court authorizes the issuance of a bench warrant extraditable within the State of Wisconsin. 15TR2375 - Default Judgment entered. Court orders: $200.50 forfeiture w/ 60 DTP or PP.
by USPS - No mail receptacle - Unable to Forward
In Person Status conference at 01-13-2016 02:00 pm

15CM-371 and 15TR-2375 - Cases Called @ 2:12 PM: Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court schedules an in person STC - if she failed to appear warrant will be issued.  Status conference scheduled for January 13, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.   Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.

Case Called @ 1:15 PM: Defendant Aereol Rose Weaver in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  DA serves complaint.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def does not wish counsel today.  Per DA:  Suggests NGP with STC scheduling to allow Def to make progress on her DL reinstatement.  NGP entered as to both matters.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for December 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
